Instruction: Prepare your ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
Coat the chicken breast in the egg and then in the bread crumbs, placing them on the baking sheet once coated.
Cook in the preheated oven until the chicken is no longer pink and the juices run clear, which should take about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven.

Layer the bottom of a 7x11-inch baking dish with half of the spaghetti sauce. Arrange the chicken breasts on top of the sauce, then pour the remaining sauce over the chicken. Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on the top.
Continue to bake until heated through and the cheeses have melted, approximately 20 additional minutes.
